quote: Captain's log, stardate 41255.6.   After delivering a party of Earth   colonists to the Strnad solar   system and providing...
scene: 1    EXT. SPACE - ENTERPRISE IN PLANET ORBIT (OPTICAL)

quote: ... them with all their basic   necessities, we have discovered   another Class M planet in the   adjoining Rubicun star system.
scene: 1    EXT. SPACE - ENTERPRISE IN PLANET ORBIT (OPTICAL)

quote: We are now in orbit there, having   determined it to be inhabited as   well as unusually lovely. It   is...
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: ... a pastoral world, which also   shows evidence of learning and   civilization. My first officer   has taken an away team down to   make contact and they are in the   process of returning to the ship.
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: Riker has sounded very enthused   in his reports.
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: He says the planet has life forms   almost identical to us.
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: Captain... !    (sees she has     interrupted)   Sorry, Troi.
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: The Doctor has something much more   important on her mind, Captain.
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: Please, Troi, do not pick up my   feelings!
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: Your feelings? All we need   are ears.
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: You've been talking about it for   days now... Shore leave for the   crew.
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: I'm tired myself.       Establishing that colony has   exhausted the entire crew, sir.   We're not a supply vessel.   Settling all those people was a   strain on everyone.
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: Is it as good as your reports,   Number One?
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: Exactly per my reports, sir.   Class M, so Earthlike, so   beautiful, it will startle you!
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: It sounds wonderful for the   children!       The Holodecks are marvelous, of   course, but nothing like giving   them open space and fresh air...
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: I've listed my report on their   customs and laws, sir. Fairly   simple, common sense things.
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: Wild in some ways, puritanical   in others. Neat as pins,   ultra-lawful, and making love at   the drop of a hat.
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: Any hat.
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: But even the happiest report has   its negatives. Let's start with   them.
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: There are none, sir. Not that   any of us can find.
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: But there is a problem here, sir!
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: I do not understand this at all!
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: It's the faulty reading I   reported, sir.
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: Sensor technicians are working   on it, sir. They've identified   it as a "glitch" in the system.
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: I take it you find no "glitch"   at all in this planet, however.
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: If you approve shore leave, sir,   we could start with a small group   at first.
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: Of course...       Wesley, if we go, you will join   the away team to evaluate this   world as a place for young people   to relax.
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: Yes, sir!
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: If all scans and observations   confirm the reports...       ... certainly I'll approve it.       Let's hope it is not too good   to be true.
scene: 3    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
location: MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER

quote: We are in orbit of a planet   designated Rubicun Three... and   have found it to be the home of   a life form who call themselves   the Edo.
scene: 6    EXT. SPACE - ENTERPRISE IN PLANET ORBIT (OPTICAL)

quote: Careful, sir...
It's all right, Lieutenant, these   are the Edo we met.
They certainly are... fit, right?
They certainly are.
Health and happiness!
A pleasant day to you!
You did return as promised!
Rivan, Liator...       Also from our vessel is Troi...
Slowly, slowly...       I must also welcome this lovely   one...       ... and this lovely one...
My pleasure.
Healthy sensuality, sir. I feel   mainly happiness and friendship.
And I welcome this huge one...       ... oh, yes, yes...
Nice planet!
But you are a young one. I do   not know your custom regarding   love.
Uh... I guess... whatever you   usually do...
Others would like to visit here   too. If you'll tell us what   limits you'd place on the   number...
Whatever pleases you. We can   discuss it at the Council   Chambers.
Shall we go there now or remain   and play?
Play?
At love. Unless you don't enjoy   that.       Perhaps you do?
And you? Yes, I can see that you   do.
Listen, maybe I'll just go on   ahead...
This is unfair to him.       We'll go to the Council Chambers.   You'll find young people your age   there.
Well... I really can't make any   promises...
You don't have to. Our rules are   simple. No one does anything   uncomfortable to them.
Come! Our people will want to   know you.
Rivan, perhaps they...can't...run.
Can't run? Sure we can run, right   sir?
That's the custom here, running...       Right! Lead the way!
"When in Rome... ," eh?
When where, sir?
Good health to you!
Happiness to you!       It's like an "Eden" here.
Good health! I thought you might   be out of breath.
Children, we've brought you a new   friend!
Hello! Join us!
Yes, please!
We may surprise you in a lot of   ways.
Everyone! We've brought the   visitors!
Please enjoy what we have!
I have traced it through all sensor   channels, Captain! It is not a   glitch... !
... or any other form of error or   malfunction, sir.
Confirmed by my readings, sir.   It's like a "shadow something"...
Exactly! As if it's not entirely   in or out of our dimension.
"What" is, Commander?
Whatever is sitting out there   without triggering our alarm   relays, Captain.
Center Main Viewer on that area.
I need more, Commander.
Permission to go to hailing   frequencies, sir?
Hailing frequencies open. On all   frequencies and language forms,   send...       Enterprise to Object off our   starboard bow. Request that you   identify yourself!
Shields and deflectors up full,   sir. Main phaser banks ready.
Hailing frequencies? Any reply?
It was something unintelligible,   Captain. Now running it through   our logic and language circuits...
Have a real look at it, Geordi!
(hurrying for the     turbolift)   Aye, sir.
Sir, my sensors read it... well,   as "half there." And it does   look...
As if it's partly...transparent.
Data, what the hell is it?
Lieutenant La Forge to Captain.
Go ahead, La Forge. What can you   make out?
This is something I've never   seen before, sir.
It's as if it isn't entirely in   our dimension, sir.
Anything else?
Negative, sir. It's something   I don't understand.
I have some information on its   first transmission, sir. It   translates as...       ... "stand by."
Sir! Sensors show something   emerging from that... that ship,   if you want to call it that.
Verified. Something very small...
Getting smaller...
Intruder alert, sir! But I   don't...       ... show a location...
Why a tiny swirl of light,   Lieutenant? Could you make out   anything else?
No, sir. Perhaps it is meant to   seem "non-threatening" to us.
The away team signal has been cut   off, Captain! We are no longer   in contact with our people!
Intruder relays do show   something...
Why has everything become a   something, or a whatever?
STATE THE PURPOSE...
STATE...       STATE THE PURPOSE OF WHAT YOU HAVE   DONE!
I am Captain Picard, commanding   this Federation starship...
STATE THE PURPOSE OF YOUR VISIT   HERE!
We have sent down what we call an   away team to make peaceful contact   with...
DO YOU PLAN TO LEAVE LIFE FORMS   HERE?
No... we are merely visiting   here...
BUT YOU DID MORE AT THE WORLD   YOU JUST LEFT. WHY HAVE YOU LEFT   YOUR OWN LIFE FORMS THERE?
The colony we just planted, sir...

We found that world uninhabited.   The life forms we left there...    (carefully choosing his     words)   ... had sought the challenge...       ... at least that's the basic   reason... had sought the challenge   of creating a new lifestyle,   a new society there.       All life on our world is driven   to... to protect its own form by   re-seeding itself as... as widely   as possible.
DO NOT INTERFERE WITH MY CHILDREN   BELOW!
Captain... I do not understand how,   but it is asking me if I was...   constructed for information   exchanges.
If there... is any way of our   learning more about whatever is   out there, Data...
Watch! You can't do this!
I want to do something too! With   you.
Uh... What?
Something you can teach me. Will   you?
Well, actually, there are some   games I... uh, don't quite know   yet...
It's playing ball. Will you teach   me?
Oh, sure. If you have a bat for   the ball, I'll show you my   favorite.       A bat...       ... a stick or branch, about this   thick, this long...
We can get it from the gardens.
Enterprise, come in.       Captain, do you read me?
Let's... it may be nothing, but   let's move our people together.
Including the boy, Wesley? He's   outside...
Is there some problem?
We've lost contact with our ship.
It's nothing these people have   done... I'm certain of that. Their   minds are so open...
Help me locate Wes. He's wandered   somewhere.
If I can take a moment of your   time, Lieutenant...
Yes, Worf... but you've got to hear   this.       Are you telling me that there's   no crime here whatsoever? No one   breaks any laws?
Once they did. Long, long ago   there was much disorder.       But not now.
But I've seen no sign of... of   police... those who enforce laws.
We have very few. They're called   "Mediators." And they are needed   only in one place each day...
The "punishment zone." An area   that's selected for a period of   time.
It's a completely random selection?
No one but our Mediators know what   place or for how long. We're very   proud of the wisdom of our   ancestors. No person ever knows   where or when a zone will be.
... and so no one risks death.
Death?
... by breaking any law.
Wait, let's explain this...
Only one punishment for any   crime.
Anyone who commits any crime in   the punishment zone dies!
The law is the law. Our peace   is built on that.
Even a small thing? Such as   ignoring a rule like "keep off   the grass?"
Then no one breaks that rule.   Who wants to risk execution?   There's always a white wall or   fence to remind anyone of a   forbidden area like that...
And just who tells visitors of   those rules?
We'd better find Wesley!
You're very clever at this!
At home we play a lot of it.    (gestures; running     ahead)   Here, toss the ball ahead of me!
No, Wes...
No! It's forbidden to disturb   the new plants... !
Couldn't you see the fence?   That's for new plants...
Don't ever go past a white   marker!
What's wrong?
Oh, no! Oh, please, no!
Speak the truth. We are   Mediators.
I said I was fine. Just some   splinters...
(staying back; through     tears)   He doesn't know; he's from another   place.
How very sad. But this zone has   been selected.
He doesn't understand!
It's always sad... now doubly so.
What's happening here?
I was chasing a ball...       ... and fell into that. I'm   really sorry!
You admit you did that? Freely?
I'm with Starfleet. We don't   lie.
It won't happen again. We   apologize.
We're sorry, too. But that   changes nothing.
Careful, Commander, they've got   some strange laws here...
I thought you reviewed the laws   here.
But they list nothing about   punishment. That's what all this   is about.
One moment, please...       Is there a witness to this   transgression?
But it was my fault; I threw the   ball past him...
We have a visible transgression,   ample witnesses, and an admission   of guilt...       ... and it deeply pains us to do   what we must. Are you prepared   for punishment?
Please?
Punishment? If you mean what the   others were talking about...
What kind of punishment? Name   it!
Death, of course! Don't make   it...       ... difficult for the boy...
Drop that; drop it now!
It's a kind of syringe...
What is this? You said "death;"   is it "poison?"
But... but of course it is!   Completely painless; the boy would   have felt nothing...       But look at him now. You've   frightened him!
He was going to kill me?
And if this Zone were still in   effect, you would all deserve   death.
It was announced you came as   friends. Is this how friends act?
Enterprise from away team, come   in.       Are you receiving us, Enterprise?
Urgent, Enterprise. Please   respond!
Condition?
scene: 44   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE EMPHASIZING DATA (OPTICAL)

quote: No sign of consciousness, but the   balance of the readings are quite   normal for him.
scene: 44   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE EMPHASIZING DATA (OPTICAL)

quote: I believe this is some form of   information exchange with whatever   is over there. At least, I hope   that's it.
scene: 44   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE EMPHASIZING DATA (OPTICAL)

quote: Any communication from our away   team?
scene: 44   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE EMPHASIZING DATA (OPTICAL)

quote: Something is blocking   communication both...
scene: 44   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE EMPHASIZING DATA (OPTICAL)

quote: ... Security, urgent. Repeating,   Enterprise from away team...
scene: 44   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE EMPHASIZING DATA (OPTICAL)

quote: This is the Enterprise,   Lieutenant. We're receiving you   now.
scene: 44   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE EMPHASIZING DATA (OPTICAL)

quote: This is an urgent call for Captain   Picard.
scene: 44   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE EMPHASIZING DATA (OPTICAL)

quote: We may need your presence here,   Captain. We have serious trouble   with... with a member of our away   team and an unusual law they have   here...
scene: 44   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE EMPHASIZING DATA (OPTICAL)

quote: Captain to Riker, stand by.       Signs of consciousness?
scene: 44   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE EMPHASIZING DATA (OPTICAL)

quote: None yet. Perhaps in minutes,   hours... I don't yet know what's   happened to him.
scene: 44   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE EMPHASIZING DATA (OPTICAL)

quote: Take him to Sickbay; call me the   instant he's awake.       Anything new on that... that thing   out there?
scene: 44   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE EMPHASIZING DATA (OPTICAL)

quote: Negative, sir.
scene: 44   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE EMPHASIZING DATA (OPTICAL)

quote: Captain to first officer. I'm   beaming down.
scene: 44   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE EMPHASIZING DATA (OPTICAL)

quote: Captain's log, supplemental. We   have encountered a strange   vessel-like object, one with   frightening power, which appears   to exist partly in another   dimension. On the world below...
scene: 50   EXT. SPACE - ENTERPRISE AND MYSTERY OBJECT (OPTICAL)

quote: ... what began as a shore leave   opportunity among delightful   inhabitants of a lovely Earthlike   planet... has led incredibly to   a death sentence...
... a death sentence proclaimed   against... one of our crew members   for what our world considers a   petty, non-criminal infraction.   How can I allow a crew member   to die for that?
How does the Prime Directive apply   to this case? Indeed if we do   save our crewmember, how will the   frightening object up here react   to that?
Care to comment privately how you   read any of this...
Unnecessary, sir.       I get strong feelings that they   are honest almost to a fault.   But they do have great respect,   even pride, in their own ways.
Welcome to our world, Captain.   We regret that our system of   justice is troubling you.
Wesley Crusher -- where is he?
In accord with the Prime   Directive, Captain, I've let them   hold him pending the outcome of   this.
He is safe and unharmed. We   promise that.
Captain Picard... I do not know   how you Earth people conduct law   and justice; even if you respect   such things...
We do.
Good, so do we. Our precepts have   been handed down from long ago.   The tranquility you see in our   lives has been made possible by   our laws...
We are a people of law. They do   sometimes bring us sadness, but   we have learned to adjust to that.   Perhaps your laws work as well...
They haven't always, but they do   now.
Do you execute criminals?
No... not any longer, that is.
You did once?
Unfortunately, yes. But since   then...
And when you did, was it believed   necessary to do so?
Can we please get to the facts   concerning our crewmember?
Yes, some people then felt it was   necessary. But we've learned how   to detect the seeds of criminal   behavior... Capital punishment   is no longer justified in our   world as a deterrent.

But you once believed execution   necessary.       So, we are not yet as "advanced"   as they are.       And since you are "advanced" in   other ways too, I suggest you use   the, ah, transfer device...
"Beam... "

... the "beam" device to permit   the Wesley boy to escape from us.   We will record him as a convicted-criminal   out of our reach...       ... an "advanced" person who   luckily escaped the barbarism of   this backward little world.
Unfortunately, we have a law   ourselves known as the Prime   Directive...
Riker has explained it to us...
Is the boy in the slightest danger   from you right now?
Until sundown?
Because you are strangers, we are   delaying enforcement of the law.   But we must act by the time of   sundown.

Then, I have another question now,   please. While orbiting... while   circling high above your world   as we do... we encountered a   strange object, a "vessel"   perhaps? Do you know of such a   thing? It was... well, you could   say not entirely real, at least   not completely what you might call   solid...
Do you mean God?
God?
God is said to be somewhere up   there. Protecting us.
Exactly... exactly how would you   describe "God?"
As you just did. As existing   both here and in another place   also.
But when God wants to show its   power, it can make itself felt   most fully.
We know.
Picard here.
CMO Crusher here, sir. Commander   Data has just regained   consciousness.
What condition? Can he talk?
He is insisting on it, sir.   Urgently.
Stand by; Picard out.       I'd rather explain about her son   to her personally.       You promise Wesley Crusher will   be safe until sundown?
You have our word.
Then, will one of you return with   me to our vessel?
Of course. I'll go as a hostage   for the boy's safety.
No, that's not it. I want you   to... identify something for me,   if you can.       Captain to Transporter Room.   Stand by for three to beam up...
I'm...frightened...
(touches her gently;     smiling)   No reason to be.
Transporter Room, energize.
But this is a ... a city. A great   city!
Captain, I've just seen the away   team report about Wesley...
In a moment, Doctor...
"In a moment... "
Exactly, Doctor, in a moment.       You were about to say... ?
Since you have all this power,   why be concerned about our laws?   You could take the boy from us!
It's not that simple.
From here we can view whatever's   outside our vessel.
Do you mean my world?! You said   we'd be high above it...
And something else that's up here   circling your world too. It's   very important to us... perhaps   to you... to know what it is.
I'm sorry, Rivan, but this was   necessary. Do you know what that   is?
Can you tell us what it is?
Is it "God?"
Now, it's very important you   answer something. How do you   recognize what it is?
Nothing will harm you, I promise!   Just tell us how you recognize   it.
It... has appeared...before. It   is... the same.
Can you speak to it... Does it   speak to you?
Captain... !
RETURN MY CHILD!
"Return... ?"
It's coming toward us, sir... !
Picard to Transporter Room,   urgent!
Yes, do that! But hurry... !
It is still coming toward us...
Transporter Chief to Captain...
One to beam down to away team   location. Hurry!
Engage, Transporter Room, urgent!   Engag...
What do you intend to do about   my son?
He is being held safely, until   sundown...
When he faces execution! Although   he has committed no crime,   certainly none that any sane and   reasonable person would...
I... apologize, sir... but this is   very difficult for me...
You saw what that thing was about   to do. I have a ship, an entire   crew to consider...
If you felt the same, you'd be   as frightened and trembling...
But I am.
Data is in Sickbay here. You'll   find him able to talk.
He's checking out fine, Doctor.
Finish it later, please.

I was an excellent choice for   them, Captain. They could   communicate with me quite...       ... I was about to say quite   "easily," but there was nothing   "easy" about it. Fortunately,   they stopped short of overloading   my circuitry...
You're saying they. It is a   vessel of some sort...
Definitely not a single "entity"   if that's what you mean, sir...   although they know the Edo worship   them as a "God thing."
They know... ?
They recognize that this is quite   expected and harmless at the   present Edo stage of evolution,   and...
What kind of vessel?

It is perhaps not what we'd   understand as a "vessel," sir.   The dimensions this one occupies   allows them to... well, to be in   several places at once. But they   consider this entire star cluster   to be theirs, and it was probably   unwise of us to attempt to place   a human colony in this area.
Of course, there are three   thousand four other planets in   this general star cluster in   which we...
Data, don't babble!
"Babble," sir? I am not aware   that I ever babble, sir. It may   be that from time to time I have   considerable information to   communicate, and you may question   the way I organize it...
Please "organize" it into brief   answers to my questions. Do they   accept our presence at this   planet?
Not yet decided, sir.
Please feel free to volunteer any   important information, however.
I volunteer that they are now   observing us, sir.
To judge what kind of life forms   we are?
No, it is more curiosity, sir.   I doubt they expect us to abide   by their value systems.
Do they... know of our Prime   Directive?
They know everything I know, sir.
And, in your opinion, if we   violated the Prime Directive.. ?
(interrupting; blurting     it)   That's not a fair question at...
Continue.

That would be a case of judging   us by our own rules, sir. If we   violate our own Prime Directive,   they might consider us deceitful   and untrustworthy.       You do recall, sir, they cautioned   us not to interfere with their   "children" below.    (looks from Beverly to     Picard)   What has happened?
The Edo want to execute my son.       I will not allow that to happen,   Jean-Luc!
Most interesting, sir. The   emotion of motherhood, compared   to all others felt by humans...
SHUT UP!
You were right, sir. I do tend   to babble.
Captain's log, stardate 41255.9.   Whatever the object or vessel in   orbit with us, it hangs there like   a "nemesis". It is one thing   to communicate with something   mysterious...
... but it is quite another to be   silently observed by it. I am   concerned whether it understands   the same concept of reason that   we do?
You sent for me, sir?
Let's talk some more, Data.
Yes sir. What level of   communication?
Any. My apologies for saying you   babbled.
But I do, sir.       It was wise to beam back the Edo   woman.
Barely in time.
The Edo's "God" is very protective   of its children.
There was no choice but to   learn...    (indicates mystery     object)   ... what we could about that thing   from her.
Apparently the Edo people had seen   it before, from time to time, sir.
But I'm sorry I had to. She was   so frightened.
Understandable. To share an orbit   with "God" is no small experience.
You have a facility for seeing   things not in the way we do, but   as they truly are.
I need help, my friend. I cannot   let Wesley or any member of this   vessel be sacrificed this way.   The Prime Directive does not   really intend that.

The problem, sir, is there!    (indicates mystery     object)   Although they have learned of the   Prime Directive from my mind, how   will they evaluate it? How do   they reason? What are their   values? Remember its warning   to us, sir.
Exactly. How do I explain not   obeying the laws down there, not   permitting young Crusher's   execution? Does that endanger   this ship and over a thousand   other lives?
Would you choose one life over   one thousand, sir?
I refuse to let arithmetic decide   questions like that!
Did you learn anything of the   relationship between the Edo and   that? Why are they so certain   it is "God?"
Any sufficiently advanced life   form can appear to others to be   that, sir.

(looks out toward the     Object)   But when they were probing my   thoughts, Captain, I could feel   that whatever they are now, they   once existed in this dimension,   just as we do. Perhaps also in   the same kind of "flesh and blood"   form. Since then, however, they   have evolved considerably further.   Their present existence in mixed   dimensions no doubt has advantages   we do not understand...
Then, in their earlier flesh and   blood existence they could have   once shared our kind of values.
The Edo share them, sir.
Why would advanced things like   that feel obliged to protect the   Edo?
Perhaps because the Edo are a   child-race by comparison.   Possibly a race which the life   forms over there "planted" here   much as we now plant human   colonies on Class-M planets.
Having fulfilled my professional   obligations regarding Commander   Data...

You now request permission to beam   down -- permission granted.       You can accompany me while I try   to resolve this.    (starts; then stops and     turns)   And you should know that whatever   the cost, I will not allow them   to execute your son.
Thank you, sir.
Take command, Data.
Aye, sir.
Almost dark.       I want the boy brought here now.
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: I'll go along with you.
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Of course.
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Captain Picard...
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: I saw you share the sky with God.   You must be Gods.    (turning to the other     Edo, eyes still     clenched)   And the boy too.
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: No, no, we're not "Gods."       Your own idea of that is much   better for you at this time...
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Mother...
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: I guess you know a lot has   happened here...
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: (nodding; holding it     in)   I know.
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Are you going to let them kill   me, sir?
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: No.    (turning to Liator and     Mediators)   But I'd like to prevent it in a   way you can understand...
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: How can we let this happen,   Liator? Everything we respect,   our law, our peace, our world's   order...
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: You are more powerful but we beg   you not to do this to us. At   least study what we once were --   hurtful to each other, savage,   thieving...
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: We understand. In fact, your   system of law and punishment may   be better than many we once had.       But he has laws he must obey too.   And one of them says he must   protect his people from harm.
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: We did not ask you to come here...
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Which has to do with another law   I must obey. All of us are sworn   not to interfere with other life   in the galaxy. I am caught   between the two. If I save this   young man, I break that law...
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: And you should be executed if you   do so!
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: I may suffer almost as much.   Starfleet takes our Prime   Directive very seriously...
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: No, it is God who will punish you!
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: That has crossed our minds too.
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Our laws have been violated. What   of justice?
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: What of justice to Wesley? Does   he deserve to die?
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: What makes our law strong is the   certainty of punishment!
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: But my son had no warning...
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: We cannot allow ignorance of the   law to become a defense...
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Is it possible we are wrong about   that? Surely there is such a   thing as too much harshness...
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: We do not dispense mercy... only   justice.
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Their sun is almost down, sir.
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Stand ready to beam out.
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: The question of justice has   concerned me a good deal lately.   Pained me. Until now, Liator.   I realize now that there can be   no justice...
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: God will destroy you!
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: ... no justice so long as laws are   absolute. Life itself is an   exercise in exceptions.
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Bravo. When has justice ever been   as simple as a rulebook, sir?       Six to beam up, Captain?
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Six to beam up.
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: God will punish you!
scene: 62   INT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Main Viewer on!
scene: 67   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)

quote: Greetings, Jailbird.
scene: 67   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)

quote: Hailing frequencies open.
scene: 67   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)

quote: Open, sir.
scene: 67   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)

quote: To the object sharing this   orbit... we will remove the human   colonists from the adjoining solar   system if signaled to do so. Or   we'll proceed on our mission, if   signaled to do that. Please tell   us...
scene: 67   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)

quote: Captain!
scene: 67   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)

quote: Is that a signal?
scene: 67   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)

quote: I was hoping for more.
scene: 67   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)

quote: More of what, sir? I'm happy it's   gone.
scene: 67   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)

quote: We're all thrilled with that, sir.
scene: 67   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)

quote: I was hoping we'd learn more about   it. But since we can't...       Take us out of here, Number One.
scene: 67   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)

quote: Gladly, sir.
scene: 67   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER (OPTICAL)
